captions.text: Meeting site: the red dunes.
Monster buggies race up and down the over 300-foot dune.
Who will make the longest wheelie without breaking their bones?
In other words, the kind of hp-madness Matthias wouldn't miss for the world.
The next morning, Matthias heads to the remote emirate Ajman.

It's a bit more concrete now.
There's a tuner named Mathia.
Cool name, by the way.
And we're on our way to meet him.

Apparently he's pretty crazy.
He's got some wicked cars,
some pretty wicked dudes too.
About 95 miles away from Dubai
is the workshop of Mathia Bellussi.
The Italian has made his name as a tuner for the ultra-rich.

This doesn't really look
like a tuning workshop.
But this is the place.
Crap!

That looks like a desert to me.
This must be the place.
There's a little Black Series.
Nice man-toys,
but Matthias wants to get to the desert and the monster buggies.

No company name, nothing.
Mathia!
There he is!

Hi Mathia.
- You're a little late.
At least you got here.

The boys in Abu Dhabi said
you could bring me to the desert.
The desert awaits.
Matthias wants to know more about the mysterious dare
the Speed Gang told him about in Abu Dhabi.
Mathia Bellussi takes him to a camp deep into the desert.
So, that's what I call a good start.

So, Matthias.
- Yes.

Now I'm going to show you
something you've never seen before.
Dude!
Those are some sick machines!

They're sick machines
for sick kids.
At least 640 hp in the back.
One of the fastest off-road vehicles there is.
Complete with sand paddle tires.
Can I drive now?

This time, with a little instruction.
- Yeah, okay.
Tell me, what does it weigh?
1,874 pounds.

Only 1,874 pounds?
- Yes.

With 640 hp?
- That's right.
This could get ugly.
Do we have to wear helmets?
In this case, no helmet.
Okay, but there's no windshield.
We've got ski goggles for you.
We arranged some ski goggles for you,
and professional glasses for me.

Why don't I get those too?
- You're not a professional.
Matthias has no idea what he's in for today.
The sand buggy is so loud they can only communicate by radio.
Matthias carefully starts out in the 150,000 dollar vehicle.
It's got a 5-gear sequential manual gearbox.
Otherwise the dune monster functions just like a normal car.
Holy moly, is this sick!

Everything's totally soft, totally easy.
It feels like...
like surfing in water or something.
Or like being on a flying carpet.
That's thanks to 1.6 feet of suspension.
This is so freaking awesome!

It's important to understand
the lay of the dunes.
Matthias is getting bolder.
Whoa! The front just went up!
It's crazy how it absorbs the power,

transfers force to the sand
and translates it into momentum!
Incredible!
And this is still just 2nd gear.
This thing has enough traction
to make a wheelie in the desert!
Did he say "wheelie"?
That brings us back to the dare Matthias heard about.
It's about time.
It's about to start.
What's about to start?
The game begins.

What game?
- The big game.

What's the big game?
- It's a surprise.
We're on our way
to a very special place,
a very special spot,
where tons of big boys
are going to have a blast.
This mysterious location is called "the big red dunes."
and is about 30 miles away, in the middle of the desert.
The distance is no problem for the ultra-fast buggies.
But only insiders like Mathia are privy to the exact location.
The boys want to keep the place to themselves.
Then they appear as if out of nowhere:
tons of Arab horsepower junkies.
Those who can afford it fly in by helicopter.
Meeting point: the red dunes.
They've all gathered here to conquer the mountain of sand.
But for that, you need an tremendous power.
The strongest buggies have over 985 hp in the back.
Okay, this has got to be

the biggest sandbox playground
I've ever seen in my life.
I've never seen anything this crazy.
The cars are so wicked.

I doubt any of these monster buggies
have less than 690 hp.
Now Matthias finally sees what the dare is about.
To race up, and then down the dune, on just two wheels:
a stunt that demands complete mastery over the vehicle,
and blind trust in the pilot.
Roger?

Roger. I'm ready.
Even if I don't really want to.
You have no choice, my friend.

Okay, then hit the gas...
but not too hard.
Damn that's steep!
Holy crap, that's freaking steep!
Mama, I wanna go home!
And he's not even flooring it.

But seriously, we're safe, right?
Will we get home in one piece?
Honestly, I hope so.

Doing a wheelie up a mountain!
No way!

Can Mathia really handle this?
Dude!

I could only see sky!
I could only see sky!
Now Mathia's gunning it.
Everybody knows our GRIP moderator isn't the best passenger, as it is.
But now he's really being put to the test.
We're going to flip backwards.

We're going to flip.
- Maybe.
Stop it! Oh god! Dude!
I've never been so scared.
A roller-coaster ride is child's play compared to this.
Mathia is pushing his dune monster to the limit.
Matthias has to suffer.
But then the driver is understanding,
and Matthias has completed the first part of the dare.
You have no idea how terrified I was.

But it's so freaking awesome!
It's absolutely nuts!

You're looking at the sky.
You only see sky!
Blue sky.

And the car is moving,
going faster and faster.

It's unbelievable.
I've never done anything like it.
This crap here

is as least as awesome
as the 24-Hours Nürburgring race,
the M3 DTM and the G-Power.
They're all in the same league.

Well?
- What?
Do you want to drive?

Let me think for a second.
No.
Honestly, it's too dangerous for me.
I won't drive.

Then thank you
for putting your trust in me.
Thank you.
Matthias blew everyone away on the dragstrip,
and became king of the quarter mile.
But in their native territory, the desert boys
pushed him to his limit.
One thing's for sure:
this isn't the last time we'll meet the desert boys in battle.

comments.text:
So liebe Grip und You Tube Gemeinde.......
Mal ein paar Tatsachen yu dem Bericht. Ajman wird Aschman ausgesprochen, 
das was da sonst erzählt wird ist genau so ein Bullshit...
Des ist keine Mutprobe, das machen die Locals regelmässig wohl gemerkt nur 
in den Winter Monaten in den Emiraten. Der Platz wo die Jungs spielen 
heisst nicht die Grosse Rote Düne Sondern der Platz heisst "Superbowl" der 
Ort ist über haupt nicht Geheim und nicht nur dieser Matthie kennt den 
Platz.Unter sich wollen die Jungs auch nicht sein. regelmässig am Wochende 
treffen sich Off Road Clubs und alle die den Platz erreichen können und 
schauen sich das Spectal an. Wie gesagt nur in den Wintermonaten. Die 
soenannte Mutprobe passiert einfach weil der Motor im Heck ist und durch 
die beschleunigung komt die Schnauze eben hoch.
ALSO KEINE MUTPROBE UND NICHTS GEHEIMNISS VOLLES
Hier die Coordianten
Schardscha
Vereinigte Arabische Emirate
24.882501, 55.728023﻿
